title: Alice in Wonderland
director: Clyde Geronimi, Hamilton Luske, Wilfred Jackson, Ben Sharpsteen

scenes.name: Alice's Curiosity
scenes.summary: Alice becomes curious after seeing the White Rabbit and decides to follow him.
scenes.firstLine: Alice was beginning to get very tired of sitting by her sister on the bank, and of having nothing to do.
scenes.lastLine: In another moment down went Alice after it, never once considering how in the world she was to get out again.

characters.name: Alice
characters.quote: What could a rabbit possibly be late for?

characters.name: White Rabbit
characters.quote: Oh dear! Oh dear! I shall be late!

scenes.name: Down the Rabbit Hole
scenes.summary: Alice falls down the rabbit hole into a strange place filled with peculiar objects and memories.
scenes.firstLine: The rabbit-hole went straight on like a tunnel for some way, and then dipped suddenly down, so suddenly that Alice had not a moment to think about stopping herself before she found herself falling down what seemed to be a very deep well.
scenes.lastLine: Down, down, down. Would the fall never come to an end!

characters.name: Alice
characters.quote: Down, down, down. Would the fall never come to an end!

scenes.name: The Pool of Tears
scenes.summary: After growing to a giant size and then shrinking again, Alice cries a pool of tears.
scenes.firstLine: Curiouser and curiouser! cried Alice (she was so much surprised, that for the moment she quite forgot how to speak good English).
scenes.lastLine: I wish I hadn't cried so much! said Alice, as she swam about, trying to find her way out.

characters.name: Alice
characters.quote: I wish I hadn't cried so much!

scenes.name: The Caucus Race
scenes.summary: Alice participates in a chaotic caucus race with several creatures to dry off after swimming in her own tears.
scenes.firstLine: There was a lot of confusion at first, but they all began running when they heard the Dodo say, 'Go!'
scenes.lastLine: At last, the Dodo solemnly presented Alice with a thimble as a prize.

characters.name: Alice
characters.quote: However, she joined in the race and was very confused about the chaotic rules and who might win.

characters.name: Dodo
characters.quote: 'The best way to explain it is to do it.'

scenes.name: Advice from a Caterpillar
scenes.summary: Alice meets a caterpillar who questions her identity and gives her puzzling advice about eating the mushroom.
scenes.lastLine: The Caterpillar crawled away into the grass, leaving Alice quite confused about his cryptic messages.

characters.name: Alice
characters.quote: 'I—I hardly know, sir, just at present—at least I know who I WAS when I got up this morning.'

characters.name: Caterpillar
characters.quote: 'One side will make you grow taller, and the other side will make you grow shorter.'

scenes.name: The Cheshire Cat
scenes.summary: Alice encounters the Cheshire Cat, who gives her perplexing advice on where to go in Wonderland.
scenes.firstLine: Alice thought she might find her way if she walked towards the forest.
scenes.lastLine: The Cheshire Cat faded away, leaving only its grin and Alice more confused than ever.

characters.name: Alice
characters.quote: 'Would you tell me, please, which way I ought to go from here?'

characters.name: Cheshire Cat
characters.quote: 'That depends a good deal on where you want to get to,'

scenes.name: A Mad Tea Party
scenes.summary: Alice attends a bizarre tea party with the Mad Hatter, the March Hare, and the Dormouse, filled with riddles and nonsensical conversation.
scenes.lastLine: Then it wasn't very civil of you to offer it.

characters.name: Alice
characters.quote: But I don't see any wine.

characters.name: Mad Hatter
characters.quote: Have some wine.

characters.name: March Hare
characters.quote: Then it wasn't very civil of you to offer it.

scenes.name: The Queen's Croquet Ground
scenes.summary: Alice plays croquet with the Queen, a game filled with cheating and chaos, amid constant threats of beheading.
scenes.firstLine: The players all played at once without waiting for turns, quarrelling all the while, and fighting for the hedgehogs.

characters.name: Alice
characters.quote: I don't think they play at all fairly.

characters.name: Queen of Hearts
characters.quote: Off with his head!

scenes.name: The Mock Turtle's Story
scenes.summary: Alice meets the Mock Turtle, who recounts his sad tale and educates her on the peculiar schooling system in Wonderland.
scenes.firstLine: 'When we were little,' the Mock Turtle went on at last, more calmly, though still sobbing a little now and then, 'we went to school in the sea.'
scenes.lastLine: 'You may not have lived much under the sea—'

characters.name: Alice
characters.quote: And what are the lessons?

characters.name: Mock Turtle
characters.quote: 'Ah, I've had such a curious dream!' said Alice, and she told her sister, as well as she could remember them, all these strange Adventures of hers that you have just been reading about.

scenes.name: Painting the Roses Red
scenes.summary: Alice helps the card painters who are frantically painting white roses red to avoid the Queen's punishment.
scenes.firstLine: We're painting the roses red. Don't tell the queen what you have seen, or say that's what we said, what, we're painting the roses red…

characters.name: Alice
characters.quote: Oh dear! Then let me help you! Painting the roses red…

characters.name: Queen of Hearts
characters.quote: Who's been painting my roses red? Who dares to taint, with vulgar paint, the royal flower bed?

scenes.name: The Royal Croquet Game
scenes.summary: Alice participates in a croquet game using flamingos and hedgehogs, observed by the Queen who threatens everyone with beheading.
scenes.firstLine: The Queen! The Queen! Cards, halt! Count off!

characters.name: Alice
characters.quote: I don't think they play at all fairly.

characters.name: Queen of Hearts
characters.quote: Off with their heads!

scenes.name: The Mad Hatter's Tea Party Encore
scenes.summary: Alice returns to the Mad Hatter and the March Hare, experiencing more nonsensical conversations and bizarre tea party antics.
scenes.lastLine: I've had enough nonsense. I'm going home. Straight home.

characters.name: Alice
characters.quote: Of all the silly nonsense, this is the stupidest tea party I've ever been to in all my life.

characters.name: Mad Hatter
characters.quote: A very merry unbirthday to you!

characters.name: March Hare
characters.quote: A very merry unbirthday to us, to us.

scenes.name: The Queen's Trial
scenes.summary: Alice attends a bizarre trial where the Queen demands sentences before verdicts and calls various characters as witnesses.
scenes.firstLine: Don't mind all that! Get to the part where I lose my temper.

characters.name: Alice
characters.quote: But that just isn't the way!

characters.name: Queen of Hearts
characters.quote: Sentence first! Verdict afterwards.

characters.name: King of Hearts
characters.quote: Uh… we called no witnesses… Uh… couldn't we hear… maybe one or two? Ha? Maybe?

scenes.name: Mad Hatter as a Witness
scenes.summary: The Mad Hatter is called as a witness during the trial, contributing to the nonsensical proceedings with confusing testimony.

characters.name: Alice
characters.quote: Twinkle, twinkle. What next?

characters.name: Mad Hatter
characters.quote: Oh… he he he he!

characters.name: Queen of Hearts
characters.quote: Off with your hat!

scenes.name: Alice's Acquittal
scenes.summary: The trial concludes abruptly when Alice grows larger and confronts the Queen, leading to a chase that ends her dream.
scenes.firstLine: You're nothing but a pack of cards!

characters.name: Alice
characters.quote: You're nothing but a pack of cards!

characters.name: Queen of Hearts
characters.quote: Off with her head!

locations.name: Wonderland
locations.quote: Alice in Wonderland, where is the path to Wonderland? Over the hill or here or there, I wonder where.

locations.name: Rabbit Hole
locations.quote: Down, down, down. Would the fall never come to an end! 'I wonder how many miles I've fallen by this time?' she said aloud.

locations.name: Tea Party Location
locations.quote: There was a table set out under a tree in front of the house, and the March Hare and the Hatter were having tea at it.

locations.name: Queen's Croquet Ground
locations.quote: The Queen's Croquet-Ground was a large one, indeed; here she saw the White Rabbit, who was nervously running about, looking for something.

locations.name: Tulgey Wood
locations.quote: 'Tulgey Wood'… Hmm, curious. I don't remember this. Now let me see…

characters.quote: Curiouser and curiouser!
characters.explanation: A vibrant pink to reflect her youthful curiosity and the wonder she experiences in Wonderland.

characters.quote: Oh my fur and whiskers! I'm late, I'm late, I'm late!
characters.explanation: A bright yellow, symbolizing his constant hurry and the urgency he brings to the story.

characters.quote: It's very rude to sit down without being invited!
characters.explanation: A deep purple, representing his eccentricity and madness in Wonderland.

characters.quote: Ah, but it's very rude to sit down without being invited!
characters.explanation: A vibrant orange, echoing his frantic energy and chaotic nature at the tea party.

characters.quote: Off with her head!
characters.explanation: A bold red, symbolizing her authority, anger, and the threats she often makes.

characters.quote: 'The best way to explain it is to do it.'
characters.explanation: A soft brown, representing his old-fashioned and somewhat stodgy attitude.

characters.quote: Who are you?
characters.explanation: A calm green, reflecting his contemplative nature and the transformative advice he gives.

characters.quote: Then it really doesn't matter which way you go!
characters.explanation: A mystical violet, capturing his enigmatic and mischievous spirit.

characters.quote: Consider, my dear. Uh… we called no witnesses… Uh… couldn't we hear… maybe one or two? Ha? Maybe?
characters.explanation: A royal blue, signifying his position of power yet underscored by his indecisiveness and mild demeanor.

characters.quote: 'When we were little,' the Mock Turtle went on at last, more calmly, though still sobbing a little now and then, 'we went to school in the sea.'
characters.explanation: A reflective sea blue, embodying his melancholic stories and aquatic background, symbolizing both his sadness and depth.
